actor_awards.notes: Received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1960 for his work in television.

filmography.title: The Robe
filmography.role_description: The disciple who betrayed Jesus, appearing in this biblical epic about the Roman tribune who commands the unit that crucifies Christ.
filmography.plot: In the Roman province of Judea during the 1st century, a Roman tribune commands the unit that crucifies Jesus and is later tormented by his guilt.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Art Direction, Best Costume Design

filmography.title: The Ten Commandments
filmography.role_description: An Egyptian taskmaster who oversees the Hebrew slaves in this monumental retelling of the biblical story of Moses.
filmography.plot: Moses, raised as a prince of Egypt in the Pharaoh's household, learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.

filmography.title: The Comancheros
filmography.role_description: A henchman for the Comancheros who crosses paths with John Wayne's character.
filmography.plot: Texas Ranger Jake Cutter arrests gambler Paul Regret, but soon finds himself teamed with his prisoner in an undercover effort to defeat a band of renegade arms merchants and thieves known as Comancheros.

filmography.title: The Greatest Story Ever Told
filmography.role_description: The commander of King Herod's forces in this expansive retelling of the life of Jesus Christ.
filmography.plot: An all-star cast epic retelling of the life of Jesus Christ, from the Nativity to the Resurrection.

filmography.title: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea
filmography.role_description: A fanatic scientist on board the submarine Seaview who opposes the Admiral's plan to save the world.
filmography.plot: The crew of a futuristic nuclear submarine must race to save the world when the Van Allen radiation belt catches fire.

filmography.title: Guns of the Magnificent Seven
filmography.role_description: A sadistic Federalist colonel who oppresses a Mexican village, prompting the rescue by the Seven.
filmography.plot: A new group of seven gunmen is hired to rescue a Mexican revolutionary leader from a brutal military prison.

filmography.title: The Manitou
filmography.role_description: A Native American medicine man recruited to battle an ancient evil spirit growing on a woman's back.
filmography.plot: A psychic's girlfriend finds out that a lump on her back is a growing reincarnation of a 400-year-old Native American demon.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Message
filmography.role_description: A powerful Meccan leader and opponent of the Prophet Muhammad who eventually converts to Islam.
filmography.plot: The story of the birth of Islam and the life of the Prophet Muhammad.

filmography.title: Day of the Animals
filmography.role_description: A Native American guide who leads a group of hikers terrorized by animals driven mad by ozone depletion.
filmography.plot: The depletion of the ozone layer causes animals at high altitudes to become aggressive and attack humans.

filmography.title: It's Alive
filmography.role_description: A police captain involved in the hunt for a murderous mutant baby.
filmography.plot: A couple's infant child turns out to be a vicious mutant that kills when it is frightened.

filmography.title: Harum Scarum
filmography.role_description: The scheming brother of a king who plots an assassination in this Elvis Presley musical.
filmography.plot: An American movie star is kidnapped in the Middle East and becomes involved in a plot to assassinate a king.
filmography.awards: Golden Raspberry Award: Nomination – Worst Actor (Elvis Presley)

filmography.title: Abbott and Costello Meet the Mummy
filmography.role_description: A henchman involved in the search for a sacred medallion in this horror-comedy.
filmography.plot: Two Americans in Cairo get mixed up with a mummy and a search for a hidden treasure.

filmography.title: Julius Caesar
filmography.role_description: The loyal slave of Cassius who assists in his master's suicide at the Battle of Philippi.
filmography.plot: The growing ambition of Julius Caesar is a source of major concern to his close friend Brutus and a group of conspirators.

filmography.title: Texas Across the River
filmography.role_description: A Comanche chief who interacts with a Spanish nobleman and a Texas gunrunner.
filmography.plot: A Spanish nobleman flees to Texas after being accused of murder and teams up with a gunrunner.

filmography.title: Jupiter's Darling
filmography.role_description: A Carthaginian officer in Hannibal's army in this musical comedy.
filmography.plot: Hannibal marches on Rome but finds himself distracted by a beautiful woman who swims into his camp.

filmography.title: Slaves of Babylon
filmography.role_description: The King of Babylon who holds the Israelites captive in this biblical adventure.
filmography.plot: The story of the prophet Daniel and the liberation of the Jews from Babylonian captivity.

filmography.title: Only the Valiant
filmography.role_description: An Apache chief captured by the cavalry whose rescue attempts drive the plot.
filmography.plot: A cavalry captain is blamed for the death of a popular lieutenant and must lead a suicide mission to hold off Apache attacks.

filmography.title: Brave Warrior
filmography.role_description: Tenskwatawa, the Shawnee religious and political leader and brother of Tecumseh.
filmography.plot: Set during the War of 1812, the film depicts the conflict between the U.S. and Native American tribes allied with the British.

filmography.title: The Lawless Breed
filmography.role_description: A man killed in a card game by John Wesley Hardin, sparking a feud with his brothers.
filmography.plot: The story of outlaw John Wesley Hardin, who tries to leave his past behind but is pursued by the law and vengeful relatives of men he killed.

filmography.title: Three Young Texans
filmography.role_description: An outlaw involved in a train robbery scheme.
filmography.plot: A cowboy robs a train to prevent his father from doing so and being blackmailed by outlaws.

filmography.title: The Lone Ranger
filmography.role_description: A renegade Indian who creates conflict between his tribe and the white settlers.
filmography.plot: The Lone Ranger and Tonto investigate raids on settlers that are being blamed on Indians but are actually orchestrated by a wealthy rancher.

filmography.title: Pillars of the Sky
filmography.role_description: A Native American chief who leads a rebellion against the U.S. Cavalry in Oregon.
filmography.plot: In Oregon Country, a cavalry sergeant tries to keep the peace between Indian tribes and the military, but a new colonel provokes a war.

filmography.title: The Tall Stranger
filmography.role_description: A cattle rustler who clashes with the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A Civil War veteran returning home is shot and left for dead by rustlers but survives to help a wagon train of settlers.

filmography.title: Sign of the Pagan
filmography.role_description: A lieutenant to Attila the Hun in this historical epic.
filmography.plot: A Roman centurion is captured by Attila the Hun but escapes to warn Rome of the impending invasion.

filmography.title: Yankee Buccaneer
filmography.role_description: A naval officer involved in a mission to disguise a U.S. ship as a pirate vessel.
filmography.plot: A U.S. Navy commander and his crew go undercover as pirates to track down a fleet of privateers in the Caribbean.

filmography.title: The Doll Squad
filmography.role_description: A villainous mastermind who plans to overthrow world governments, opposed by an elite team of female agents.
filmography.plot: A squad of elite female agents is tasked with stopping a madman who plans to release a plague-infected rats to conquer the world.

filmography.title: Batman & Mr. Freeze: SubZero
filmography.role_description: The voice of the tragic villain who seeks to save his wife at any cost. (Animated Film)
filmography.plot: Mr. Freeze kidnaps Batgirl to use her organs to save his dying wife, leading Batman and Robin on a race against time.
filmography.awards: Annie Award: Win – Best Home Video Animated Production

filmography.title: The Bears and I
filmography.role_description: A Native American who rents a cabin to the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A Vietnam veteran moves to the wilderness to find peace and ends up raising three orphaned bear cubs while dealing with local tensions.
